Adds HT16K33 I2C Matrix support to LedControl* Refactored LedControl to move methods into Devices interfaces.* Added a new device interface to support HT16K33 matrices based on port of AdaFruit I2C LED Backpack library.* Added tests for the new deviceThe following options have been added to the Led.Matrix constructor to support the new device:_isBicolor_ (default = false) If set to true the _led_ function will use the state param to set the color e.g. 0 = off,  on = any value from LedControl.COLORS and the led will be set to that color. The existing behaviour of 0 = off, 1 = on still applies for monochrome matrixes_addresses_ optional array of I2C addresses for devices e.g. [0x70, 0x71, 0x77]If addresses is not specified, the default addresses start at 0x70 and increment from there up to the total number of devices (specified by the _devices_ option, as per the original code for MAX7219 matrices). e.g. if neither _devices_ nor _addresses_ are specified, the default will be a single matrix with address 0x70.The new interface is confirmed to work with OCROBOT and AdaFruit bicolor as well as AdaFruit monochrome HT16K33 matrix.

I've also made some unit tests more aggressive about checking that values are converted appropriately as they're passed around, and commented note-frequency-duty equivalencies to help the test read nicer.* Fix lint error* Address review feedback- Test that `note()` is case-insensitive- Better description of default octave- One-line Piezo.prototype.note- s/frequncy/frequency- Note tests demonstrate the difference between note letter and octave number better
